text: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC.
HEALTH, SAFETY & ENVIRONMENT (HSE) MANUAL
SECTION 1: HSE POLICY & COMMITMENT
1.1 HSE Mission Statement
SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally

words.text: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally

text: responsible workplace for all employees, contractors, and visitors. Our goal is Zero Accidents

words.text: responsible workplace for all employees, contractors, and visitors. Our goal is Zero Accidents

text: and Injuries. We integrate Safety as the primary KPI in every operational decision, ensuring

words.text: and Injuries. We integrate Safety as the primary KPI in every operational decision, ensuring

text: compliance with all Philippine laws and international standards for logistics and warehousing.

words.text: compliance with all Philippine laws and international standards for logistics and warehousing.

text: 1.2 Management Responsibilities
Management is responsible for:
● Providing necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and ensuring its proper

words.text: Providing necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and ensuring its proper

text: use.
● Conducting regular safety audits and risk assessments across all sites (warehouses,

words.text: Conducting regular safety audits and risk assessments across all sites (warehouses,

text: yards, and fleet operations).
● Implementing corrective actions for all reported safety deficiencies and hazards.

words.text: Implementing corrective actions for all reported safety deficiencies and hazards.

text: 1.3 Employee Responsibilities
Every employee is responsible for:
● Adhering strictly to all safety rules, procedures, and Work Instructions (WI).

words.text: Adhering strictly to all safety rules, procedures, and Work Instructions (WI).

text: ● Wearing the required PPE for their assigned tasks and work areas.

words.text: Wearing the required PPE for their assigned tasks and work areas.

text: ● Identifying and reporting all potential hazards, near-misses, and unsafe conditions

words.text: Identifying and reporting all potential hazards, near-misses, and unsafe conditions

text: immediately to their direct supervisor or the HSE Officer.

words.text: immediately to their direct supervisor or the HSE Officer.

text: ● Participating actively in all safety training and drills.

words.text: Participating actively in all safety training and drills.

text: SECTION 2: WAREHOUSE AND MATERIALS HANDLING
SAFETY
2.1 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Mandatory PPE required in all warehouse and yard areas:

words.text: Mandatory PPE required in all warehouse and yard areas:

text: ● Safety Vests: High visibility vests required at all times.

words.text: Safety Vests: High visibility vests required at all times.

text: ● Safety Footwear: Steel-toed boots required for all workers involved in cargo handling

words.text: Safety Footwear: Steel-toed boots required for all workers involved in cargo handling

text: and near heavy machinery.
● Gloves: Appropriate gloves for handling cargo (anti-slip, cut-resistant, thermal for cold

words.text: Gloves: Appropriate gloves for handling cargo (anti-slip, cut-resistant, thermal for cold

text: storage areas).
2.2 Forklift and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) Operation

words.text: 2.2 Forklift and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) Operation

text: ● Only certified and authorized personnel are permitted to operate forklifts and other

words.text: Only certified and authorized personnel are permitted to operate forklifts and other

text: MHE.
● Maximum speed limits within the warehouse must be strictly observed.

words.text: Maximum speed limits within the warehouse must be strictly observed.

text: ● Pedestrian right-of-way must be maintained; pedestrians must use designated

words.text: Pedestrian right-of-way must be maintained; pedestrians must use designated

text: walkways.
● Forklifts must be inspected prior to every shift (Pre-Operation Check).

words.text: Forklifts must be inspected prior to every shift (Pre-Operation Check).

text: 2.3 Storage and Racking Safety
● Never exceed the documented maximum load capacity of the racking system.

words.text: Never exceed the documented maximum load capacity of the racking system.

text: ● Clearance must be maintained around fire exits, fire fighting equipment, and electrical

words.text: Clearance must be maintained around fire exits, fire fighting equipment, and electrical

text: panels.
● Pallets must be stable, properly wrapped, and the load must not extend beyond the

words.text: Pallets must be stable, properly wrapped, and the load must not extend beyond the

text: edges of the pallet.
SECTION 3: TRANSPORTATION & FLEET SAFETY
3.1 Driver Fitness and Vehicle Condition
● All drivers must possess a valid professional driver's license and undergo mandatory

words.text: All drivers must possess a valid professional driver's license and undergo mandatory

text: refresher training every two years.
● Drivers must perform a Daily Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR) before operating any

words.text: Drivers must perform a Daily Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR) before operating any

text: company vehicle. Any defects must be reported and corrected before departure.

words.text: company vehicle. Any defects must be reported and corrected before departure.

text: ● No use of mobile phones or electronic devices while the vehicle is in motion.

words.text: No use of mobile phones or electronic devices while the vehicle is in motion.

text: 3.2 Fatigue Management
● Drivers must adhere strictly to mandated driving hours and rest periods to prevent

words.text: Drivers must adhere strictly to mandated driving hours and rest periods to prevent

text: fatigue-related accidents.
● Drivers must report any physical signs of excessive fatigue immediately and pull over

words.text: Drivers must report any physical signs of excessive fatigue immediately and pull over

text: safely.
SECTION 4: EMERGENCY RESPONSE & REPORTING
4.1 Accident and Incident Reporting (Refer to Incident/Accident Report

words.text: 4.1 Accident and Incident Reporting (Refer to Incident/Accident Report

text: Forms)
● All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-misses (events that could

words.text: All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-misses (events that could

text: have caused harm) must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.

words.text: have caused harm) must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.

text: ● An investigation must be conducted for every incident to determine the root cause and

words.text: An investigation must be conducted for every incident to determine the root cause and

text: implement preventative measures.
4.2 Fire and Emergency Evacuation
● All employees must be familiar with the Site Evacuation Plan, assembly points, and the

words.text: All employees must be familiar with the Site Evacuation Plan, assembly points, and the

text: location of fire extinguishers.
● Fire Drills must be conducted at least annually.

words.text: Fire Drills must be conducted at least annually.

text: ● In the event of a fire, the priority is to sound the alarm, evacuate, and only attempt to

words.text: In the event of a fire, the priority is to sound the alarm, evacuate, and only attempt to

text: fight the fire if trained to do so and if the fire is small and contained.

words.text: fight the fire if trained to do so and if the fire is small and contained.

text: 4.3 First Aid
● First aid kits are maintained in designated, easily accessible areas (e.g., Office, Dispatch

words.text: First aid kits are maintained in designated, easily accessible areas (e.g., Office, Dispatch

text: Center, Warehouse Office).
● A list of certified First Aiders for each shift must be posted publicly.

words.text: A list of certified First Aiders for each shift must be posted publicly.
